title: Design for Printed Textile-Mikado, Series #650-654
provenance: This collection was donated to the Cooper-Hewitt, National Design Museum in 1969 by Alexander Girard
medium: Gray and white paper mounted to white tracing paper
description: Large flat white flower motif alternating with white squares and gray paper squares. The inspiration for this design was the sixteen petaled chrysanthemum, the emblem of the mikado, or emperor of Japan.  The square at the center of each flower may refer to the tsuba, or ornamental sword guard.
name: collage
